body_html:
Ok, I was able to get all zeros by setting the embedding_initializer=keras.initializers.Zeros()!

I also didn't realize that the Constant initializer would take an arbitrarily shaped value -- I thought it only accepted scalars. It's not super clear in the docs, but I can see that it makes sense now.

Thanks!

I'll close this but it would be nice if there was a deprecation warning that came up when trying to use the weights argument.
body_text:
Ok, I was able to get all zeros by setting the embedding_initializer=keras.initializers.Zeros()!
I also didn't realize that the Constant initializer would take an arbitrarily shaped value -- I thought it only accepted scalars. It's not super clear in the docs, but I can see that it makes sense now.
Thanks!
I'll close this but it would be nice if there was a deprecation warning that came up when trying to use the weights argument.
body:
Ok, I was able to get all zeros by setting the `embedding_initializer=keras.initializers.Zeros()`!

I also didn't realize that the `Constant` initializer would take an arbitrarily shaped value -- I thought it only accepted scalars. It's not super clear in the docs, but I can see that it makes sense now.

Thanks!

I'll close this but it would be nice if there was a deprecation warning that came up when trying to use the `weights` argument.
